headline: McCormick (MKC) Profit Margin Slips to 11.5%, Testing Bullish Narratives on Earnings Quality
summary: McCormick (MKC) reported earnings that are forecast to grow at 8.84% per year, with revenue expected to increase at 4.8% annually. Both figures are running behind the broader US market’s outlook. The company’s net profit margin sits at 11.5%, slightly lower than last year's 11.9%, and its earnings growth over the last five years has averaged a modest 0.5% per year. With stable but slower growth rates and ongoing dividends, investors are weighing continued high-quality earnings and a share...

headline: Jim Cramer on McCormick: “It’s Too Hard for Me”
summary: McCormick & Company, Incorporated (NYSE:MKC) is one of the stocks in Jim Cramer’s game plan for this week. headline: McCormick Q3 Earnings: Volume Led Growth, Shares Fairly Valued
summary: Get the latest on McCormick & Company's Q3 results, sales growth, and cost pressures. Discover key takeaways for investors.

headline: MKC Q3 Deep Dive: Cost Pressures Offset Volume Growth as Guidance Tightens
summary: Food flavoring company McCormick (NYSE:MKC) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 2.7% year on year to $1.72 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.85 per share was 4.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
